FAQ

Frequently Asked Questions

Here are some frequently asked questions. If your query is not answered here, contact support.

  • Preparation
  • Taking the e-learning course
  • Managing your booked speaking lessons
  • Taking the online speaking course
  • Others

Preparation

How should I take lessons?

If your e-learning course name does NOT include the word "FULL"
Refer to Get started (link to guidance page).

If your e-learning course name includes the word "FULL"
You can take all the e-learning course lessons besides the EZ to Talk lessons. Please check the following for the effective learning of both courses.

Preparation
  1. Go back to MyPage and click the "start lesson" button of the e-learning course.
  2. If you are required to create a Learning Path, take the Diagnostic Test and create your Learning Path by following the instructions on the screen.
How to take the EZ to Talk lessons

Get started shows the basic process to take the lessons. However, please follow the process shown in Step XX (how to proceed with your self-learning) of Get started.

  1. On Study tasks, find the lesson you need and download the PDF teaching materials. Make a note of the lesson title and whether it is Grammar, Reading or Listening.
  2. Go back to MyPage and click the "start lesson" button on your e-learning course.
  3. Click "All activities" on the top of the page.
  4. Click the correct tab for Grammar, Reading or Listening on the top right of the page.
  5. Search for the same lesson by entering the lesson title, (which you made a note of beforehand) into the search bar.

The lesson you need will be listed, so start the lesson. If you have already taken that lesson on the following e-learning course, we recommend taking the same lesson again as preparation or follow-up to your online speaking lessons.

How to take the lessons of the e-learning course

You can take a lesson from either your Learning Path or from All Lessons. The Learning Path is your own personalized program of recommended lessons. All Lessons is where you can choose a lesson on a topic that interests you.

  1. Go back to MyPage and click the "start lesson" button on your e-learning course.
  2. Take lessons in the order designed by your Learning Path
What is Skype?

Skype is a software which makes it possible to talk with people remotely, free of charge, to make a video call with your computer's camera, and to have a text chat via the internet.

What devices do I need to prepare for my Skype lessons?

You will need:

  • an internet connected PC with Skype installed
  • a headset or a set with a mic and speaker
  • a Skype ID (also called Skype Account)
  • Please use a stable internet line when you take online speaking lessons. If you take lessons on unstable internet line when you take online speaking lessons. If you take lessons on un-stable Wi-Fi or channels provided by mobile phone carrier, the connection may be interrupted.
  • If you already have ahave already ha d your Skype ID, you can use it. If not, you musthave to create a new ID.
  • We recommend getting a web camera in order to enhance yourto prepare web camera in order to enhance a learning, effect if your PC does not have one.
How can I get Skype and Skype ID?

Refer to Get Skype in Orientation.

I want to change my Skype ID for online speaking lessons. How can I change it?

Click "Change Skype ID" on the top of the page, input your correct "Skype ID" into the box, and save it. Please note that this process allows you only to change which Skype ID you want to use for your online speaking lessons, and does not allow to change your Skype ID registered to Skype itself.

How can I get Skype and Skype ID?

The Speaking Course page will allow you to:

  1. Find out how to learn.
  2. Resolve questions you have about your learning.
  3. Check your study tasks (e.g. the order of e-learning lessons you should take, and the theme of your online speaking lessons).
  4. Confirm what you should do next.
  5. Download the preparation materials for online speaking lessons.
  6. Book, confirm and cancel your online speaking lessons.
  7. Check the assessments for your online speaking lessons when they are graded by your instructor.
  8. Change the Skype ID you use for online speaking lessons.
Can I take lessons on my smartphone?

You can take the e-learning course on smartphone app. Check the system requirements and notes about smartphone on the system requirement page. You can take online speaking lessons by Skype app for smartphone.

However, we recommend to take online speaking lessons on your PC because the lesson preparation materials (PDF) should be besides you during the online speaking lesson and it is hard to operate both Skype and PDF on the small screen of a smartphone.

Taking the e-learning course

Can I take more than one lesson at a time for self learning?

We recommend you take lessons in the assigned order because EZ to Talk is designed to help you learn English in the most efficient way by taking the lessons in the correct sequence. You are also required to show what you have learned on your assigned e-learning lessons when you take your online speaking lessons.

The lesson program I tried to take does not seem to work correctly. It seems to have some technical problems. What should I do?

Refer to the Help page.

オンライン英会話レッスンの予約を管理する

How long is one speaking lesson?

One speaking lesson takes 25 minutes.

How many speaking lessons can I take on this course?

TBC

How do I book an online speaking lesson?

Refer to Step XX, XX, XX of Get started

How far in advance must I book an online speaking lesson?

You can book a lesson up to 5 minutes before its scheduled start time.

Are there any closing days for lessons?

Lessons are closed on public holidays in the Philippines and some public holidays in Japan. You can not book lessons on closed days on the booking system. Lessons might also close at short notice in the event of a typhoon or any other incident in the Philippines. If it happens, we will put an alert on the login page and lessons booked on that day will be canceled by the instructors.

How many speaking lessons can I book at a time?

If you want to book from the next day onwards of the lesson day, you can book up to 3 lessons per day. "A day" means from 1 a.m. of that day to 1 a.m. of the next day. If you want to book lessons on the current day, you can book as many as you want within the amount you can take on your course.

Will I take lessons without a break if I book 2 or more lessons back-to-back?

When successive lessons are booked, 5 minutes break is taken after eac lesson has finished. If you want to take lessons continuously without a break, ask your instructor when you start the lesson.

How many weeks of each teacher's schedule are available to book?

Teachers' schedules for the next month are open to book, and they are updated every day.

How do I check my booking history?

Click the "Booked lessons" button and "Current" "Completed" "Incomplete" "Cancelled" bookings are listed separately.

How do I cancel my booking?

The procedure is as below.

  1. Go to "Current booking" by clicking "Booked lessons" (or look at your "Study tasks"), find the lesson you want to cancel, and click the "Cancel" link
  2. Click "OK" button.

The cancelation will be confirmed, the notification mail is sent to your registered email address and the cancelled booking is listed on "Cancelled" tab of the "Booked lessons" page. Please confirm your cancelation.

How much notice must I give to cancel my booking?

You can cancel your lessons up to 3 hours before the start time of the lesson. You cannot cancel after 3 hours before the start time. If you miss the lesson without cancelation, the booking is processed as "Incompleted" and you lose one of the remaining number of credits to take lessons on your course, which will be the same as if the lesson has completed.

How can I check the remaining amount of speaking lessons?

TBC

Taking the online speaking course

Will I receive a reminder before the start time of my lesson?

Yes, you will. You receive an email from the booking system on your registered email address, 30 minutes before the start time of the lesson. Note that you can not cancel after the allowed 3 hour cancellation time, even if you did not receive the reminder. We recommend that you confirm your schedule on this page frequently.

What should I prepare for speaking lessons?

First, you have to study the assigned preparation lessons as Get started guides. Second, for starting the online lesson, you have to set up Skype as described below.

  1. Set up your head set or a set of mic and speaker on your PC or smartphone. Also set up the web camera, if needed.
  2. Start Skype on your PC or smartphone
  3. Input your Skype ID and password on Skype and sign in. You must create a Skype ID in advance.
  4. You should receive a contact request from the instructor if this is your first lesson with them. Be sure to approve the request before the lesson starts, otherwise the instructor can not contact you without your approval.
  5. Try the sound test to check your speaker and mic works correctly. How to carry out the sound test is documented on the official Skype website (https://support.skype.com/ja/faq/FA265/).

Skype setup is now completed. How to start the lesson will be covered next.

How do I start a speaking lesson?

You must prepare for the lesson before the start time. At the start time, you should receive the Skype call from the instructor. Answer the call and start the lesson.

What should I do if there is no call from the teacher at the start time of my lesson?

Search the following Skype ID of the QQ English support, who manage the online speaking lesson system and call them on your Skype, If you can not use Skype, contact the phone number below.

*QQ English support

  • Skype ID: qqe-support4
  • Phone number: 050-5539-3040 (open from 9am - 8pm on weekdays, 12am - 5pm on Saturdays and Sundays, except for closing days)
What should I do if there is no call from the teacher at the start time of my lesson?

You can start and take lesson until 15 minutes after the scheduled start time. The end time of your lesson is as scheduled, not extended. If you start more than 15 minutes after the scheduled start time, the booking is processed as "Incompleted" and you lose one of the remaining number of credits to lessons on your course, as if the lesson was completed.

The Skype call is not working. / The call is disconnected during the lesson.

Check the following.

  • Is the internet connection working?
  • Is your headset or mic connected correctly?
  • Does your PC or smartphone recognize your headset or mic?
  • Is the volume too low small or muted?
  • Are you logged-in to Skype correctly?
  • Have you already approved the contact request from the instructor?

In case of disconnection during the lesson, check the following.

If you can not make a call from your end
You should try restarting your PC.

If you can call but the instructor can not answer or call
The instructor has to check the situation. Wait until the instructor contacts you by Skype chat.

If you cannot resolve the problem by the previous procedure, contact QQ English support.

What will happen if I cannot get my lesson curriculum finished within the time frame (within 25 minutes)?

The instructor should structure your lesson in order to finish the curriculum in 25 minutes. However, it might well happen you do not finish the curriculum because your learning of preparation lessons was not efficient. If it happens, the lesson time is not extended and you will get the assessment "1 - Fair" after the lesson.

What should I do if the amount of speaking lesson time I took is shorter than the time frame (25 minutes) due to troubles caused by the teacher's side? (e.g. internet connection problem, teacher's being late)?

We return one lesson's worth of credit if you speaking lesson is shorter than 20 minutes due to problems caused by the teacher's side. If this occurs and you request a lesson credit, contact Reallyenglish support (support-japan@reallyenglish.com), and report the following:

  • Background of your request (explain the situation you have faced)
  • Your user ID
  • Date, sｓtart time and end time of the lesson
  • Instructor's name

After we have received your request, we will investigate the situation and will refund one lesson's worth of credit if we recognise the problem was caused by us. We will not refund you if you did not take the lesson due to troubles caused by your side. (e.g. internet connection problem of your side, or your being late)

My lesson has been cancelled even though I did not cancel it. What has happened?

It is not common, but it could be that your booking is canceled by your instructor because of sickness, bad weather or troubles in the Philippines.

What is ​"1 - Fair", "2 - Good" or "3 - Excellent" shown by clicking Show feedback?

These are the assessments of your skill which the instructor estimates in that lesson.

  • 3 - Excellent: understood, used and applied the key expressions well.
  • 2 - Good: understood and used the key expressions.
  • 1 - Fair: understood the key expressions, but more reviews will be needed for practical use.

*Key expressions are those in the e-learning course.

Others

I receive messages or contact requests from strangers on Skype. Why did it happen and what should I handle those?

You may receive spam on Skype if you do not change the configuration of privacy on Skype. These are like spam mail sent to your email address, but they don't imply a security incident like an information leak. You can learn how to control spam on the official Skype website (http://blogs.skype.com/2012/08/23/skype-skype101/).

I already have a private account for the online speaking course. Is it possible to take EZ to Talk by using this account?

We provide online speaking course of EZ to Talk with QQ English, the online speaking service provided by Kyukyubin corp., however, you can not use your private QQ English account for EZ to Talk. You also cannot integrate the lesson histories and cannot take EZ to Talk lessons by using the points or membership fee belonging to your private account.

After I complete EZ to Talk, I want to take another e-learning course or online speaking course in private in order to improve my English skills further. What should I do?

You can buy our e-learning courses on the Reallyenglish web site and buy an online speaking course from the QQ English web site. However, you cannot use the account you used for EZ to Talk, so you will have to make a new user account. (Your user account for EZ to Talk will be deleted after a certain period of time.)

Need more help?

Please use the "report a problem" form to contact Reallyenglish support.

EZ to Talk is a set of online English speaking lessons supporting the Practical English 6 e-learning course.

EZ to Talk consists of preparation lessons (e-learning), live lessons (speaking lessons) and follow-up lessons (e-learning). Have a look at the steps below to find out how to begin studying.

1 - Find the lesson you need, and download the PDF teaching materials.

Make a note of the lesson title and whether it is Grammar, Reading or Listening.

2 - Log in to your Reallyenglish Mypage and launch Practical English 6

Click the ‘Start the lesson’ button to launch Practical English 6.

3 - Search for the same lesson in Practical English 6.

Click the tab for Grammar, Reading or Listening, and search for the lesson title in either Japanese or English.

4 - Book an English speaking lesson on EZ ToTalk

Select the date and time of your choice, and check the ‘ticket use’ using the curriculum search.

5 - Select the tutor and the time you would like your lesson

Click ‘Open’ for a reservation confirmation screen.

6 - Confirm your reservation

Select the ticket always (???). Please put the check in the corresponding of if you can not o er lessons in 2 QQEnglish side reasons. (???) If you have requests or comments to the instructor, it is possible to tell ithem in advance.

7 - Accept tutor’s Skype request

Before the lesson starts, your instructor will send you a Skype request. Please approve this or you will not be able to contact each other on Skype! Now you’re ready for your lesson.

8 - After your conversation lesson, find your tutor’s review

When your instructor has assessed your lesson performance, you’ll see it at the top of your dashboard page. Click the View feedback button to see more details.

9 - Continue on to the self-learning lessons.

You must find these lessons in Practical English 6 and study them yourself. These lessons will review and apply the expressions you have learned in your online conversation.
